comments.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.) Create a file "test.js" with the following contents: window.a = { 'beer': function() { print("beer was called"); } }; window.a.beer(); 2.) Now run the closure compiler with "ADVANCED_OPTIMIZATIONS" as the compilation level. For example: java -jar compiler.jar --compilation_level=ADVANCED_OPTIMIZATIONS --js=test.js What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The expected output should be: window.a={beer:function(){print("beer was called")}};window.a.beer(); Instead the output is: window.a={beer:function(){print("beer was called")}};window.a.b(); What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? I'm using the version in subversion. I'm running my test on Ubuntu Linux.

alternately, you can use quotes in both places:

a['beer']();
Issue 52 has been merged into this issue.
